title: 110_hr6785
content: The Act titled "No One Strike Eviction Act of 2008" aims to reform mandatory eviction policies. The United States Housing Act of 1937 is amended to include a review of eviction and denials of tenancy, expedited procedures for grievances, and considerations for mitigating circumstances and innocent owners. The United States Housing Act of 1937 is amended to include considerations for mitigating circumstances and innocent tenants in eviction and tenancy denial decisions. The Quality Housing and Work Responsibility Act of 1998 is amended to change eligibility criteria from "household" to "person" in cases involving criminal offenses. The Quality Housing and Work Responsibility Act of 1998 is amended to change eligibility criteria from "household" to "person" in cases involving criminal offenses. The amendment includes removing references to "applicant's household" and replacing it with "applicant" in certain sections. Additionally, subsection (d) is redesignated as subsection (e) and a new subsection is added for the review of denial of applications. The denial of an application under this section is subject to review according to the United States Housing Act of 1937. Innocent applicants cannot be denied based solely on familial relationships with individuals with criminal convictions. Section 577 of the Quality Housing and Work Responsibility Act of 1998 is amended to address termination of tenancy and assistance for illegal drug users and alcohol abusers in federally assisted housing. The section addresses the termination of tenancy or assistance for individuals in federally assisted housing. It includes provisions for review and protection of innocent tenants. The United States Housing Act of 1937 is amended to prevent the termination of tenancy based solely on the familial relationship of the tenant to a person in violation of criminal or drug-related activities. The United States Housing Act of 1937 is amended to prevent the termination of tenancy based on criminal or drug-related activities by a tenant's household member or guest, if the tenant was unaware of the activity or was a victim of criminal activity.
